issues.description:
Function wager() retrieves the transaction origin (tx.origin) using the ORIGIN opcode. Use msg.sender instead.
See also: https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/develop/security-considerations.html#tx-origin
issues.title: Use of tx.origin

issues.description:
Function play() retrieves the transaction origin (tx.origin) using the ORIGIN opcode. Use msg.sender instead.
See also: https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/develop/security-considerations.html#tx-origin
issues.title: Use of tx.origin

issues.description: A reachable exception (opcode 0xfe) has been detected. This can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. This is acceptable in most situations. Note however that `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.
issues.title: Exception state

issues.description: This contract executes a message call to an address provided as a function argument. Generally, it is not recommended to call user-supplied addresses using Solidity's call() construct. Note that attackers might leverage reentrancy attacks to exploit race conditions or manipulate this contract's state.
issues.title: Message call to external contract

issues.description:
In the function `play()` the following predictable state variables are used to determine Ether recipient:
- block.number
issues.title: Dependence on predictable environment variable

issues.description: In the function `play()` block.blockhash() is calculated using a value from storage at index keccac_1461501637330902918203684832716283019655932542975_&
issues.title: Dependence on predictable variable

issues.description: This contract executes a message call to to another contract. Make sure that the called contract is trusted and does not execute user-supplied code.
issues.title: Message call to external contract

issues.description: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function play(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
issues.title: Transaction order dependence

issues.description: The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.
issues.title: Unchecked CALL return value

issues.description: The contract account state is changed after an external call. Consider that the called contract could re-enter the function before this state change takes place. This can lead to business logic vulnerabilities.
issues.title: State change after external call

issues.description:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `donate()`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
issues.title: Integer Overflow

issues.description: The contract account state is changed after an external call. Consider that the called contract could re-enter the function before this state change takes place. This can lead to business logic vulnerabilities.
issues.title: State change after external call
